title: Hand Tools Quiz
description: Test your knowledge of essential hand tools. From screwdrivers to pliers, how many can you identify?

questions.question: Which hand tool has an adjustable jaw width controlled by a thumbscrew, used to turn nuts and bolts of various sizes?
What are tin snips (aviation snips) used for?
options: Cutting sheet metal and thin materials

questions.question: Which tool is a pointed metal rod used with a hammer to drive nails below the wood surface?
What is a pry bar (crowbar) primarily used for?
options: Leveraging apart joined materials, removing nails, and prying

questions.question: Which hand tool has a handle with a flat or Phillips tip inserted into screw heads to turn them?
What is a utility knife (box cutter) used for?
options: Cutting cardboard, rope, drywall, and other materials with a retractable blade

questions.question: Which measuring tool uses a weighted string to determine a perfect vertical line?
What are channel-lock pliers (tongue-and-groove pliers) known for?
options: Having an adjustable jaw that can grip objects of many different sizes

questions.question: Which hand tool is a flat metal bar with teeth, used to smooth and shape metal or wood?
What is a chalk line (snap line) used for?
options: Marking long, straight lines on surfaces by snapping a chalk-coated string

questions.question: Which tool has two crossing blades and is used for cutting paper, fabric, wire, and other thin materials?
What is an awl used for?
options: Making a small pilot hole or marking point in wood or leather

questions.question: Which hand tool is essentially a small, heavy hammer with rubber or plastic heads, used to tap without marring?
What are diagonal cutting pliers (side cutters) designed for?
options: Cutting wire and small fasteners with angled cutting edges

questions.question: Which precision measuring tool can measure inside and outside dimensions to hundredths of an inch?
